text: Good Friday, a momentous day in the Christian timetable, is globally recognized to commemorate the crucifixion and demise of Jesus Christ at Calvary. This solemn event prompts introspection, prayer, and reverence for the sacrifice made by Jesus for the redemption of humanity.Why is Good Friday observed? On this day, Christians come together with loved ones to contemplate the profound love and selflessness exhibited by Jesus Christ. According to Christian doctrine, Jesus voluntarily endured pain and death on the cross to extend salvation to mankind.
